revised_title: Laboratory Experiments on Whirlpools: Exploring the Effects of Swirl and Vortex Formation
tldr: This study investigates the behavior of whirlpools in water at the submerged entrance to a pipe, focusing on trumpet-shaped circular weirs for removing excess water from reservoirs. The authors conducted laboratory experiments using various methods of water supply to control the swirl and observe the reduction in discharge due to vortex formation. The results demonstrate the types of instability caused by weak vortices and the significant decrease in discharge when vortices are present.
